title: GS-QA: Comprehensive Quality Assessment Benchmark for Gaussian Splatting View Synthesis
author: Pedro Martin (Instituto de Telecomunicações), António Rodrigues (Instituto de Telecomunicações), João Ascenso (Instituto de Telecomunicações), Maria Paula Queluz (Instituto de Telecomunicações), ...
relevance_why: The paper evaluates quality metrics in synthesized videos, which could inform future projects on audio-visual alignment and enhance audio processing methodologies by applying learned visual context.
background: This work assesses the quality of video content generated by Gaussian Splatting techniques, comparing subjective human evaluations against objective quality metrics.
contribution: This paper introduces a comprehensive subjective assessment study to evaluate static Gaussian Splatting methods, achieving insights into the performance of various quality metrics tailored for visual synthesis.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Prior studies mainly focused on quality assessments in Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF), lacking specific evaluations for Gaussian Splatting and static content.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work establishes a dedicated quality assessment benchmark for Gaussian Splatting generated videos, enabling better understanding and future improvements in visual rendering methodologies.

key_innovation: The study provides a publicly accessible database of subjective assessments and objective metric evaluations, serving as a foundational tool for future research.
real_world_impact: This work's findings can improve the quality of rendered 3D scenes in applications like virtual reality and gaming, potentially leading to more immersive user experiences.
limitations: The study primarily focuses on static scenes while dynamic scenes remain less explored, indicating opportunities for future research.

new_terms.Gaussian Splatting: **Gaussian Splatting** is a method of representing 3D scenes using anisotropic 3D Gaussians, allowing for efficient rendering and reconstruction of visual content.
new_terms.Double Stimulus Continuous Quality Scale: **Double Stimulus Continuous Quality Scale (DSCQS)** is a subjective testing method where participants evaluate two video outputs side by side on a continuous scale.

open_sourcing: The original and synthesized videos along with quality scores are made available in the GS Quality Assessment (GS-QA) database.
